content:
• Friday, May 25, 2018
  • ABMD

    PRAH +3% on MidCap 400 move; ABMD to S&P 500

    • ABIOMED (NASDAQ:ABMD) is heading into the S&P 500 as part of a series of index changes announced by Standard & Poor's.
    • The firm, part of the S&P MidCap 400, will replace Wyndham Worldwide (NYSE:WYN) in the 500; Wyndham Worldwide is heading for a spin-off that will make it more representative of a mid-cap firm, and so will head to the MidCap 400.
    • PRA Health Sciences (NASDAQ:PRAH) is moving into the MidCap 400; it's up 3% after hours. Making room there along with ABIOMED is Microsemi (NASDAQ:MSCC), set to be acquired by Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP). All those moves are effective prior to next Thursday's open.
    • Meanwhile, Wyndham Hotels and Resorts (NYSE:WH-OLD), soon to spin off from Wyndham Worldwide, will join the MidCap 400 before next Friday's open. It will replace GameStop (NYSE:GME), now more representative of a small-cap; it goes to the SmallCap 600 to replace Fred's (NASDAQ:FRED), which was at the bottom of the 600.
    • And Perspecta (PRSP.W-OLD), set to spin off from DXT Technology (NYSE:DXC), will join the MidCap 400, replacing Office Depot (NYSE:ODP), which is heading to the SmallCap 600 to replace Roadrunner Transportation Systems (NYSE:RRTS).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 3 Comments

  • SAVE

    Airline stocks soar as oil prices plunge

    • Airline stocks are big winners from today's crashing crude oil prices, giving a boost to the Dow Jones Transports: SAVE +3.7%, ALK +3.3%, LUV +3.2%, AAL +3.1%, DAL +2.7%, ALGT +2.6%, JBLU +1.9%, SKYW +1.9%, HA +1.9%, UAL +1.7%.
    • Also, the U.S. Department of Transportation reportedly has told Congress it opposes a Senate bill that would require new rules prohibiting airline fees that are not “reasonable and proportional.”
    • Trade group Airlines for America has said the provision would result in “government-mandated price controls” and should be rejected.ETFs: JETS
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 8 Comments
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm can resume talks with China about NXP acquisition

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) has received permission to resume talks with China about the NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) acquisition, according to Dealreporter sources.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word. 
    • Qualcomm shares closed today up 1.5% to $59.96.
    • NXP closed today up 4.7% but has slipped 1.7% aftermarket.
    • Previously: NXP Semiconductors +2.4% on report US, China reach ZTE deal (May 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 36 Comments
  • IHRTQ

    M&A chatter swells up around Pandora again

    • A drop in Pandora Media (P -4.9%) today on no apparent catalysts may tie back to some M&A commentary from its chief financial officer.
    • Barron's points out that CFO Naveen Chopra took a question at a B. Riley conference yesterday about comments from Liberty Media (FWONA -0.3%) CEO Greg Maffei (also Pandora's chairman) alluding to "synergies" between Pandora and iHeartMedia (OTCPK:IHRTQ), in which Liberty might be interested.
    • “I’m not sure it would be very smart for me to claim that the vision of the Chairman of our company is babbling,” Chopra said, adding “there’s a lot of overlap between our businesses. ... To the extent that that’s where Greg sees opportunity, it’s hard to argue with that.” He did accentuate that Liberty and Sirius XM (SIRI +0.5%) don't control Pandora and that independent directors are looking out for maximizing shareholder value.
    • SunTrust analysts today listed M&A prospects as part of their thesis for Pandora as well, Barron's notes.
    • Previously: Pandora to exchange $193M in convertible notes to extend maturity (May. 24 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 8 Comments

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3.30 PM (05/25/2018)

    • Gainers: QUIK +16%. QSII +13%. AGYS +9%. CAVM +8%. INAP +7%.

  • ENTMF

    Peppa Pig firm Entertainment One rises as JPMorgan boosts target

    • Canadian media firm Entertainment One (OTCPK:ENTMF) is up 5.3% in OTC trading after JPMorgan boosted its price target on a sunny outlook for the company's family operations.
    • The company, home to the popular British Peppa Pig children's franchise, has "significant valuation upside" thanks in part to price inflation and increasing worldwide monetization opportunities, not to mention M&A, the firm says (ITV made a preliminary takeout proposal in 2016 that was later withdrawn). (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Company guidance for doubling retail revenues between 2015 and 2020 looks "too conservative," the note says.
    • JPMorgan raised its price target to 432p from 376p, implying 45% upside. Shares closed today up 6.2% in London, to 298.40.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • UPL

    Ultra Petroleum -10% as Stifel downgrades, citing weak natural gas outlook

    • Shares of Ultra Petroleum (UPL -10.5%) are buckling under the combined weight of crashing crude oil prices and an analyst downgrade, tumbling to a new 52-week low.
    • Stifel downgraded shares to Hold from Buy with a $1 price target, slashed from $3, with analyst Michael Scialla citing deteriorating long-term natural gas fundamentals.
    • Scialla says supply growth for nat gas appears set to outpace incremental demand from liquefied natural gas exports, Mexican exports and industrial sources.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 17 Comments
  • CIG

    Brazil authorizes military to clear trucker protest; shares extend losses

    • Brazil's Pres. Temer has ordered the army to clear highways clogged by the continuing truckers strike that has disrupted food and fuel supplies throughout the country.
    • The government announced last night that it had reached a 15-day truce with the truckers in exchange for the elimination of a federal fuel tax and a diesel price freeze for at least 30 days, but Temer said a "radical minority" of truckers had not returned to work, prompting his decision.
    • No trucks reportedly have been able to enter the Santos port, halting soy exports, meat group ABPA said 152 poultry and pork processing plants had indefinitely suspended production, and gas stations ran out of fuel across the country.
    • Among major Brazilian shares in U.S. trading: CIG -3.8%, VALE -3%, BBD -2.9%, ITUB -1.9%, BSBR -1.7%, EBR -1.6%, PBR -1.4%, VIV -0.5%.
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BRF, EWZS, BZQ, BRAQ, UBR, BRAZ, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 14 Comments

    General Cannabis backers register possible share sale

    • The prospectus provides for the offering of up to 6M shares by selling shareholders (the company would receive no proceeds) upon exercise of Series 2018 warrants.
    • OTCQX:CANN +0.85% on the session, but has slipped off the highs since the filing hit.

  • BSTI

    Citi upgrades Best

    • Citi upgrades Best (NYSE:BSTI) from Neutral to Buy.
    • Best shares are up 5.6% to $11.84.

  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate +4.8% post-earnings; Evercore bullish on Amazon expansion

    • Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF.A +4.8%, LGF.B +4.5%) is riding higher today after Q4 earnings last night boosted by TV profits.
    • Reacting to the report, Evercore analyst David Joyce noted better than expected revenues and OIBDA -- and while he expects a "flattish" OIBDA for fiscal 2019, he's expecting continued encouragement from an aggressive international expansion on Amazon Prime (starting in the UK and Germany and spreading to 15 countries over three years). (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Joyce has an updated $31 price target, implying 27% upside.
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 2 Comments

  • VTGN

    Oppenheimer bullish on VistaGen; shares up 62%

    • Thinly traded nano cap VistaGen Therapeutics (VTGN +61.9%) is up on a whopping 53x surge in volume in apparent response to a bullish call by Oppenheimer's Jay Olsen (Outperform/$6) who says lead antidepressant candidate AV-101 should be a big winner considering its ketamine-like efficacy with less side effects.
    • Topline data from its first Phase 2 study should be available by year-end. A data readout from a larger Phase 2, ELEVATE, is expected by mid-2019.
    • AV-101 is an NMDA receptor antagonist, what the company says is a next-generation approach to treating major depressive disorder (MDD). Shares had been mired in a long-term downtrend, losing about 80% of their value since 2016, before today's action. Last month, shares sold off after the publication of a study on esketamine, also an NMDA receptor antagonist, that showed mixed results in MDD patients.
    • Previously: Vistagen down 11% on mixed esketamine data (April 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 3 Comments
  • TLSNY

    Telia in talks for $1B-plus purchase of Bonnier TV operations

    • Swedish telecom Telia (TLSNY -3.1%) is in advanced talks to buy the television operations of media group Bonnier for 10B-12B kronor (about $1.15B-$1.38B), the company confirmed.
    • That would bring together TV channels including TV4 in Sweden and MTV3 in Finland under the telecom's roof.
    • The potential deal reflects Telia's interest in acquisitions in its core Nordic markets (and also is of a piece with other industry content deals, such as AT&T's deal to buy Time Warner).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • SEDG

    SolarEdge pullback a buying opportunity, Roth Capital says

    • SolarEdge Technolgies (SEDG +4.5%) is on the rebound as Roth Capital says it sees the stock's two-day 15% pullback as a buying opportunity, reiterating a Buy recommendation and $70 price target.
    • Roth analyst Philip Shen blames the sharp decline on renewed expectations that a launch of a rival offering from Huawei is imminent, but says the "vast majority" of Huawei inverters sold in the Europena Union are without optimizers.
    • Shen also says his recent checks suggest U.S. distributors have "little to no awareness" of a Huawei launch.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 12 Comments
  • PLUS

    More on ePlus's Q4 results

    • ePlus (PLUS +1%) reported Q4 nets sales of $330.4M (-0.7% Y/Y). Segment sales: Technology $320M (-0.8% Y/Y) and financing $10.4M (+0.8% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Overall margins: Gross improved by 175 bps to 24.7%; operating was flat at 5.6% and Adj. EBITDA improved by 42 bps to 7.07%.
    • Q4 Segment margins: Technology, gross improved by 191 bps to 22.7%, operating improved by 30 bps to 4.3% and Adj. EBITDA was up by 72 bps to 5.76%; financing, gross declined by 417 bps to 86.3%, operating declined by 1,004 bps to 46.5% and Adj. EBITDA declined by 997 bps to 47.4%.
    • Technology segment's adjusted gross billing for Q4 was $441.7M (-3.7% Y/Y), the decrease was due to completion of project for a large corporate customer in Q3.
    • Company authorized repurchase of up to 500K shares over the 12-month period commencing May 28, 2018.
    • FY19 Outlook: Tax rate of 29%
    • Previously: ePlus misses by $0.03, misses on revenue (May 24)
    • Transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • XOM

    Energy stocks swoon as Saudi Arabia, Russia near deal to lift production

    • Crude oil prices are slammed by reports that Saudi Arabia and Russia are hammering out terms of a deal to jointly increase oil production by as much as 1M bbl/day; WTI -3.2% at $68.45/bbl, Brent -2.5% at $76.77/bbl.
    • Russian Energy Minister Novak met with his Saudi counterpart, Khalid al-Falih, in St. Petersburg to discuss the deal, with Novak saying "the moment is coming when we should consider assessing ways to exit the deal very seriously and gradually ease quotas on output cuts."
    • Energy stocks are sharply lower for the second straight day: XOM -2%, CVX -3.1%, RDS.B -2.4%, BP -2.9%, COP -5.4%, APA -4.6%, APC -3.4%, DVN -4.4%, EOG -3.1%, PXD -2.9%, SLB -3.4%, HAL -4.6%, WFT -7.7%, BHGE -3.9%, NOV -3.4%, VLO -2.8%, MPC -2.6%, ANDV -2.2%, PSX -3%, HES -5.5%, CHK -6.1%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, XES, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, IEZ, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, PXI, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI

    • New target represents a 16% upside to yesterday’s close. 
    • Veeva Systems shares are up 2.2% to $78.84.

  • NXPI

    NXP Semiconductors +2.4% on report US, China reach ZTE deal

    • NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) is among the companies surging on a Fox Business report that the US has reached a tentative deal with China on ZTE.
    • Eased US-China relations makes it more likely that Qualcomm’s (NASDAQ:QCOM) acquisition of NXP will win Chinese antitrust approval.
    • NXP shares are up 2.4% to $114.21. 
    • Qualcomm shares are up 0.5% to $59.39.   
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 12 Comments
  • ANW

    Platts: Aegean Marine cutting clients' credit terms

    • Aegean Marine Petroleum (OTC:ANW -0.8%) has begun limiting payment terms for its marine fuel customers to as little as 14 days after delivery, Platts reports.
    • ANW's new credit terms will be helpful for its balance sheet but may mean the bunker fuel supplier will struggle to compete with rival companies offering more generous terms, according to the report.
    • ANW missed an April 30 deadline to file its 2017 annual report to the SEC, saying it expects a significant change in results from the previous year and needs additional time to review its financial statements.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 17 Comments
  • VALE

    Reuters: Vale sees SD11 mine topping iron ore output forecasts

    • Vale (VALE -2.3%) reportedly expects iron ore production at its SD11 mine in Brazil to reach 58M metric tons this year, higher than its official forecast of 50M-55M metric tons.
    • The expected increase is due mainly to selling more "canga," or iron ore with a higher grade of contaminants, since it has shown strong demand, according to the report.
    • Vale has said it expects the mine to produce 90M metric tons/year of iron ore when it completes its rampup in 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 8 Comments
  • FCSC

    Fibrocell executes 1:5 reverse split

    • Aimed at regaining compliance with Nasdaq's $1 minimum bid price listing requirement, Fibrocell Science (FCSC +18.5%) institutes a 1:5 reverse split of its common stock effective today.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 3 Comments
  • GXP

    Merger of Great Plains Energy, Westar Energy clears final regulatory hurdle

    • Great Plains Energy (GXP +1.5%) and Westar Energy (WR +1.6%) receive final approval from regulators in Kansas and Missouri for their planned merger, completing a two-year effort.
    • The stock-for-stock merger creates a holding company of ~$15B equity value, which will be named Evergy and will be traded on the NYSE under the EVRG ticker.
    • The combined company will serve ~1.6M customers in Kansas and Missouri, and will own, operate and maintain more than 51K miles of distribution lines and 13K MW of generation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 5 Comments
  • ROKU

    Roku +2.9% as Citron covers short, goes long

    • Roku (NASDAQ:ROKU) is up 2.9% after a change of heart from short seller Citron Research, which says it's now covered its short and gone long on the streaming stock.
    • In November, with recent IPO Roku on the verge of a $50 stock price, Citron tweeted that the stock had become a joke and would trade back to $28. (It almost did.)
    • "But now everything has changed, and it is time to re-evaluate," Citron says, noting "the [over-the-top] movement has become a megatrend that cannot be ignored."
    • It's trading at its biggest discount to OTT peers despite being the only pure play that generates ad revenue, Citron says.
    • It's also taken a fresh look at valuation after Disney's acquisition of BAMTech as well as a move up in Netflix shares (that could make Roku an interesting takeout for Netflix, Citron says).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 18 Comments
  • NXGN

    Quality Systems up 15% on FQ4 beat

    • Thinly traded Quality Systems (QSII +15.3%) is up on modestly higher volume after posting fiscal Q4 and full-year results after the close yesterday.
    • FQ4 revenues were up 3% to $135.8M while non-GAAP earnings were down 18% to $10.4M.
    • Fiscal 2019 guidance: revenue: $532M - 548M (+2% from midpoint); non-GAAP EPS: $0.70 - 0.78 (+6% from midpoint).
    • Previously: Quality Systems beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM

  • Treasurys continue rally on EU periphery worry

    • We might have expected the bid for Treasurys to vanish after the president this morning said the June 12 summit with North Korea "could" still happen. But troubles in the EU periphery have yields falling in Western Europe and the U.S.
    • Spain is driving the narrative today, with the future of PM Rajoy in doubt and corruption convictions for former officials in his ruling party. Spanish stocks are  down 2.1%, and the 10-year yield is up eight basis points to 1.48%. Italian shares are off 1.4%, and its 10-year yield is up 14 basis points to 2.54%.
    • The German 10-year Bund yield is down 8.5 basis points to 0.39%, and the 10-year U.S. Treasury is lower by 5.5 basis points to 2.92%. TLT +0.8%, TBT -1.6%.
    • ETFs: TLT, TBT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, VGLT, TLH, UBT, SPTL, DLBS, VUSTX, TYBS, DLBL
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    Tesla settles Autopilot lawsuit

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) struck a deal to settle its class action lawsuit filed by six Model S and Model X owners over allegations that the Autopilot system was unreliable and potentially dangerous, according to Reuters.
    • U.S. regulators are still assessing the effectiveness of the Tesla Autopilot system.
    • Financial terms of the settlement weren't disclosed.
    • Shares of Tesla are down 0.39% to $276.76 in early trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 407 Comments
  • APHA

    M&A in pot players should be considerable - Eight Capital

    • Toronto-based investment shop Eight Capital is bullish on M&A activity in the marijuana space. Analyst Graeme Kreindler says the deal pace should ramp up considerably since the cannabis industry is in its infancy.
    • Aphria (APHQF), Aurora Cannabis (ACBFF) and Hydropothecary (HYYDF) are most likely to attract outside investment, possibly from an alcohol, tobacco or pharmaceutical company.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Selected tickers: OTC:HMLSF, OTC:CMMDF, OTCPK:MJNA, CGC, CRON, MJ, OTCQB:AERO, OTCPK:AMMJ, OTCPK:BLOZF, OTCQX:CANN, OTCQB:CBDS, OTCPK:CBIS, OTCQB:CVSI, OTCPK:ERBB, OTCPK:FBEC, OTCQB:GBLX, OTCPK:GRSU, OTCPK:HEMP, OTCPK:MYDX, OTCPK:GRNH, GWPH, OTCQB:KSHB, OTCQB:MSRT, OTCQX:OGRMF, OTCQB:PHOT, OTCQB:PMCB, OTCPK:PNTV, OTCQB:RMHB, OTCQB:SGBY, OTCQX:SPRWF, OTCQB:SRNA, OTCQX:THCBF, OTCQX:TRTC, OTCPK:UBQU
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 41 Comments
  • ATOS

    Atossa expects gross proceeds of $13.4M from recently expired rights offering

    • Atossa Genetics (NASDAQ:ATOS) announces that the Company’s previously announced rights offering resulting in gross proceeds of ~$13.4M, expired on May 24, and are no longer exercisable.
    • Closing date is May 30.
    • Shares are up 2% premarket.
    • Previously: Atossa files for $25M rights offering (May 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • SBGL

    Sibanye-Stillwater hits back at union allegations of unsafe work practices

    • Sibanye-Stillwater (NYSE:SBGL) rejects allegations made by the AMCU union which suggests the miner knowingly puts its employees at risk in unsafe conditions underground.
    • According to the union, a seismic event on May 22 caused a fall of ground at SBGL's Ikamva mine, leaving two employees injured, and a similar incident happened on May 21 at the Manyano mine, where two workers were seriously hurt.
    • SBGL acknowledges the incidents but says the AMCU’s insinuation that it willfully put its employees at risk is part of an agenda pursued by the union that consist s of "continually making mischievous allegations, and disseminating erroneous and clearly fake information to the media,” causing reputational damage for the company.
    • SBGL -4.6% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 19 Comments
  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell -1.9% as Morgan Stanley drops to Underweight

    • Cincinnati Bell (NYSE:CBB) is 1.9% lower premarket after a cut to Underweight at Morgan Stanley, from Equal Weight.
    • The firm points to Hawaiian Telcom, which could prove a drag on Cincinnati Bell's core and cut its premium valuation amid integration challenges.
    • Hawaiian Telcom approved a buyout by CBB in November, after which Morgan Stanley resumed coverage of CBB at Equal Weight.
    • The firm trimmed its price target on CBB to $14 from $16; shares closed yesterday at $15.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • ADSK

    Goldman Sachs raises Autodesk price target after earnings

    • Goldman Sachs maintains a Buy rating on Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) but raises the price target from $60 to $150, an 8% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Heather Bellini says the firm continues to see “ARR growth as the primary performance indicator, place a lower emphasis on subs growth given the impact from conversions to Collection plans, and the unpredictable nature of cloud subs.” 
    • The analyst expects continued strength in M2S and conversions should continue to accelerate and peak next year.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word. 
    • Autodesk shares are down 5% premarket to $131.95.  
    • Previously: Autodesk -4.4% on Q1 beats, downside EPS guide for Q2 (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • FL

    Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am (05/25/2018)

    • FL +13% on Q1 result.
    • EVFM +10% on closing of public offering of common stock and warrants.
    • NWY +7% on guidance.
    • AVGR +5%.
    • YRD +6% on Q1 result.
    • CAVM +6% as CFIUS finds no issue with merger.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • HLF

    Herbalife Nutrition to execute self-tender at $52.50; shares down 7% premarket

    • Herbalife Nutrition (NYSE:HLF) slips 7% premarket on the heels of its announcement that almost 50M shares have been offered in its Dutch auction self-tender at or below $52.50.
    • The company expects to purchase ~11.4M shares at $52.50 in cash for a total of ~$600M.
    • Previously: Herbalife launches self-tender for up to $600M of common stock; shares up 2% premarket (April 18)
    • Update: Carl Icahn announced that he tendered his ~46M shares in the offer, acknowledging that only 11.4M will be purchased.
    • Update: On May 30, the company announced that it will purchase 11,428,571 shares at $52.50 each. Since the tender offer was oversubscribed, the proration factor was 22.991123%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 75 Comments
  • SAN

    EU periphery roughed up - today it's Spain

    • Political uncertainty in Italy over the past couple or weeks has fed the rout in government bonds for the EU peripheral countries (namely Italy, Spain to an extent), but growing calls to remove Spanish PM Mariano Rajoy are doing the trick today.
    • At issue are the corruption-related convictions of a number of former officials of Rajoy's ruling party. The centrist Ciudadanos party today indicated it will back a no-confidence vote in Rajoy unless he calls a snap election.
    • "Rajoy’s chances of completing his term are minimal, it’s a matter of timing now,” says Oxford Economics' Angel Talvera.
    • Most of Europe is in the green, but Spain's IBEX 35 has tumbled 2% and Italy's MIB 1%. Government bond yields are lower in Germany and the U.K., but Spain's 10-year yield is up 7 basis points to 1.47%, and Italy's 7.5 basis points to 2.476%.
    • Checking the Spanish banks, Santander (NYSE:SAN) and BBVA are both down more than 4% premarket.
    • ETFs: EWP, EWI, HEWI, HEWP, DBSP, DBIT, FLIY
     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 4 Comments

  • PBR

    Brazil says truck strike suspended but major union rejects deal

    • It is unclear how many striking Brazilian truckers will return to work today after Brazil’s government said last night that it had reached an agreement with several unions to temporarily halt a four-day strike but one of the country’s biggest unions said it would continue the work stoppage.
    • The Brazilian Association of Truckers, which says it represents 700K of Brazil’s ~1M independent drivers, walked out of talks yesterday and rejected the agreement.
    • Petrobras (NYSE:PBR), whose shares plunged 15.3% in yesterday's trade following its controversial decision to cut diesel prices by 10% for 15 days, +2.2% premarket as CEO Pedro Parente pledged there would be no more fuel price cuts.
    • The government reportedly has proposed to compensate PBR for up to 1B reais ($274M) in losses if the company maintains a 10% reduction in diesel prices for 60 days.
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BRF, EWZS, BZQ, BRAQ, UBR, BRAZ, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 1 Comment

    Northern Dynasty, First Quantum end deal; Pebble mine in jeopardy

    • Northern Dynasty Minerals (NYSEMKT:NAK) -32% premarket on news of the termination of its option agreement with First Quantum Minerals (OTCPK:FQVLF), throwing development of the Pebble mine into turmoil.
    • In a framework deal announced in December, First Quantum agreed to buy into the Pebble Partnership for $150M over four years, at the end of which it would have an option to become a 50% owner; the original April 6 deadline to finalize the deal had been extended to May 31.
    • The companies provide no details on the lack of final agreement.

  • GPS

    Gap earnings call highlights

    • Gap (NYSE:GPS) CEO Art Peck explained on yesterday's conference call that the retailer took the short term pain of clearing inventory in Q1.
    • "If you have too much inventory or the wrong inventory, holding on to it does not make it better," he said.
    • Peck and team maintain that the retailer was on trend with its apparel assortment and that it was properly assorted in stores, but operational issues held back its performance.
    • "The root cause of the challenges is not significant product acceptance issues, but rather operational miss steps around timing of inventory received, breath of the assortment and lack of gaps in some categories," clarified CFO Teri List-Stoll.
    • Gap execs said they "feel good" about the start to Q2.
    • Gap earnings call transcript
    • Shares of Gap are down 7.74% in premarket trading.

  • ZOES

    Zoe's Kitchen warns on delivery disruption

    • Zoe's Kitchen (NYSE:ZOES) says it will drastic action after posting soft results in Q1.
    • The company plans to slow future new unit growth and will conduct a thorough review of under-performing restaurants, according to CEO Kevin Miles.
    • "Additionally, we are taking steps to reduce our G&A infrastructure and will re-allocate resources towards marketing and technology initiatives to drive sales," he noted.
    • During the conference call, Miles added a warning that applies across the restaurant sector. "We also believe that disruption from delivery and discounting has created headwinds," he observed.

    • Shares of Zoes are down 28.68% in premarket trading to $10.32.

  • FL

    Foot Locker rallies on earnings beat

    • Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) reports comparable-store sales down 2.8% in Q1.
    • Excluding the effect of foreign currency fluctuations, sales decreased 1.5%.
    • Gross margin rate squeezed 110 bps to 32.9%.
    • SG&A expense rate grew 50 bps to 19%.
    • Merchandise inventories dropped 5.4% Y/Y to $1.21B.
    • Store count -70 Y/Y to 3,284.
    • "The flow of premium product continues to improve, with increasing breadth and depth in the most sought after styles from our key vendors," said Richard Johnson, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer.  "This led to first quarter results which were above our expectations.  With the strength of our strategic vendor partnerships and our central position in youth culture, we continue to believe that we are poised to inflect to positive comparable-store sales growth as we progress through the year."
    • FL +12.52% premarket.
    • Previously: Foot Locker beats by $0.20, beats on revenue (May 25)
